/**
 * @returns A new `Promise` along with its `resolve` and `reject`.
 *
 * @remarks
 * Yes, the 'executor' passed to a Promise is executed immediately.
 * https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise#Parameters
 */export var createPromise=function createPromise(){var resolve;var reject;var innerPromise=new Promise(function(innerResolve,innerReject){resolve=innerResolve;reject=innerReject;});return{innerPromise:innerPromise,reject:reject,resolve:resolve};};
